reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Halting the spread of HIV and reducing TB prevalence in Eswatini

description.narrative: Eswatini - TB/HIV - National Emergency Response Council on HIV and AIDS - NERCHA. This program has the following goals: Halt the spread of HIV and reverse its impact in Swazi society. RSSH: Ensuring adequate health systems to support the attainment of health service targets, especially relating to HIV/AIDS, TB and Malaria. To achieve a 35% reduction of TB prevelance rate by 2019 to 907/100 000 of 2013. The objectives of this program are: HIV -75% reduction of new HIV infections among AGYW by 2022. 90% reduction of new HIV infections among infants aged 18 - 24 months born to HIV positive mothers by 2015. HIV - Reduce 50% deaths amongst PLHIV and in particular those with TB/HIV co-infection. Increase access to HIV services among key populations( sex workers, MSM) to 90% by 2022. At least 90% of PLHIV know their HIV status by 2022. At least 90% of PLHIV that know their HIV status are initiated on treatment by 2022. At least 90% of patients on ART are virally suppressed by 2022. To scale up and sustain patient level information system in all facilities by 2022. To improve the health products procurement and supply chain management systems, and monitoring of rational use of health products in the country. To build capacity of human resources for health with a focus on supply chain management, community health services and health information systems. To increase TB case detection rate and treatment success rate. To provide treatment and support to all DR TB patienst and reduce MDR prevalence rate among new TB cases
